{0} is not a valid kernelBufferCount value. The maximum number available is affected by {1}, {2} and {3} properties.

capture function requires specifying a minimum of two input arguments. The SDRRx system object to capture with and the size of the proposed capture. e.g. capture(rx, 500) returns 500 samples. Type 'help capture' to learn more.
Capture size (Samples) must correspond to a whole number of samples. Rounding up to the nearest whole sample.
Capture size (Seconds) must correspond to a whole number of samples. Rounding up to the nearest whole sample.

Requested capture length ({0} Samples) exceeds maximum value for this number of channels ({1} Samples). Use 'EnableOversizeCapture' to risk compromising data contiguity in return for a larger capture length.
Capture ended prematurely due to reception of invalid data from the SDR hardware.
Data is not contiguous at indices: {0}. To guarantee contiguous data disable EnableOversizeCapture.
Provided UserMetadata field {0} overwrites the existing generated field {1} of the Metadata.
capture function returns a maximum of three output arguments: [Data, Metadata, Filename]. Type 'help capture' to learn more.

capture function only returns a Filename as an output argument when the 'Filename' name-value pair is specified as an input argument. e.g. [~,~,ACTUAL_FILENAME] = capture(RX, 500, 'Filename', MY_FILENAME). ACTUAL_FILENAME will vary from MY_FILENAME when the 'Timestamp' name-value pair is used. Type 'help capture' to learn more.
